required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety And Toleration Of Maraviroc Administered To Subjects With Various Degrees Of Renal Impaired And Normal Renal Function
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Parallel Group, Single And Multiple Dose Study To Evaluate The Pharmacokinetics, Safety And Toleration Of Maraviroc Administered To Subjects With Various Degrees Of Renal Impaired And Normal Renal Function

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess whether a dosing adjustment is needed in patients with renal impairment.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measured Concentration (AUClast)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast) measured in nanograms * hour divided by milliliters (ng*hr/mL).
AUCtau: area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero to the end of the dosing interval (tau); measured in nanograms * hours divided by milliliters (ng.hr/mL).
Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) within the dosing interval; measured in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours post-dose; normal Day -3 and Day 7; mild moderate: Day 7; severe and ESRD: Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Percent protein binding (protein unbound maraviroc (MVC) fraction [percent free]) was determined by rapid equilibrium dialysis. Percent free = 100 - percent bound.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Time Curve From 0 to Infinity (AUCinf)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero to the time infinate in subjects who received single dose treatment; measured in nanograms * hour divided by millilters (ng*hr/mL).
Time (hours) of first occurrence (Tmax); time after dosing when Cmax (maximum plasma concentration) occured.
Elimination half-life (t1/2) measured in hours: time required for half the quantity of maraviroc to be metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal Clearance (CLR) in Subjects With Normal, Mild, Moderate and Severe Renal Function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hour 0 (prior to MVC dosing [single dose] or prior to last MVC dose [multiple dose]) to 72 hours post-dose ; hours 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, and 72.
secondary_outcome.description: Renal clearance (CLR) measured in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

secondary_outcome.measure: Derivation of Renal Clearance in Subjects With Normal, Mild, Moderate and Severe Renal Function: Ae
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hour 0 (prior to MVC dosing [single dose] or prior to last MVC dose [multiple dose]) to 72 hours post-dose ; hours 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, and 72.
secondary_outcome.description: Ae: amount of drug excreted unchanged in the urine; measured in milligrams (mg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemodialysis Clearance of Maraviroc (MVC) in Subjects With End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Undergoing Hemodialysis: CLdD
secondary_outcome.description: CLdD: dialysate clearance before dialysis; measured in milliliters per minute.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Maximum Increase and Decrease in Supine Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Normal renal function: screening, Day -3 to Day -1; normal, mild and moderate RI: Day 7 to Day 10 and follow-up; severe RI: Day 1 to Day 4 and follow-up; ESRD: Day 1, Day 4, and follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with absolute values of supine systolic blood pressure (BP) measured in millimeters of mercury (mm/Hg), range: <90 mmHg; and supine diastolic blood pressure, range: <50 mmHg. Number of subjects with a maximum increase and decrease from Baseline in supine systolic BP ≥ 30 mmHg. Number of subjects with a maximum increase and decrease from Baseline in supine diastolic BP ≥ 20 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Pulse Rate < 40 and > 120 Beats Per Minute
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Normal renal function: screening, Day -3 to Day -1; normal, mild and moderate RI: Day 7 to Day 10 and follow-up; severe RI: Day 1 to Day 4 and follow-up; ESRD: Day 1, Day 4, and follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with pulse rate < 40 beats per minute (BPM), number of subjects with pulse rate > 120 BPM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Maximum EGC QTC, QTCB and QTCF Intervals
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Normal renal function: screening, Day -3 and Day -1; normal renal function, mild and moderate RI: Day 7 to Day 9 and follow-up; severe RI: screening, Day 1, Day 3, Day 4, and follow-up; ESRD: screening, Day 1, Day 3, Day 4, and follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Single 12-lead ECG: number of subjects with maximum QTC interval, maximum QTCB interval (Bazett's correction), and maximum QTCF interval (Friderica's correction) measured in milliseconds (msec); range: 450 to <480 msec, 480 to <500 msec, and >500 msec. Maximum QTC interval increase from Baseline; citeria: change = ≥ 30 msec to < 60 msec, and change = ≥ 60 msec.

arm_group.description: Subjects with Normal Renal Function (Creatinine Clearance > 80mL/min) (I) Maraviroc single dose, followed by (II) Maraviroc + Saquinavir/Ritonavir
Subjects with Mild Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance >50 and ≤80 mL/min)
Subjects with Moderate Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance ≥30 and ≤50 mL/min)
Subjects with Severe Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance <30 mL/min)

Subjects with End Stage Renal Impairment receiving Hemodialysis(Creatinine Clearance <30 mL/min) (I) Maraviroc single dose one hour following completion of hemodialysis, followed by (II) Maraviroc single dose three hours prior to start of hemodialysis

intervention.description: Maraviroc 300 mg (150 mg x 2 tablets) x single dose
Maraviroc 150 mg tablet twice daily x 7 days
Ritonavir 100 mg capsule twice daily x 7 days
Saquinavir 1000 mg (500 mg x 2 tablets) twice daily x 7 days
Maraviroc 150 mg tablet once daily x 7 days
Ritonavir 100 mg capsule twice daily x 7 days
Saquinavir 1000 mg (500 mg x 2 tablets) twice daily x 7 days
Maraviroc 150 mg tablet once every 48 hours x 7 days
Ritonavir 100 mg capsule twice daily x 7 days
Saquinavir 1000 mg (500 mg x 2 tablets) twice daily x 7 days
Maraviroc 300 mg (150 mg x 2 tablets) x single dose
Maraviroc 300 mg (150 mg x 2 tablets) x single dose one hour following completion of hemodialysis
Maraviroc 300 mg (150 mg x 2 tablets) x single dose three hours prior to start of hemodialysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stable Renal Function defined as ≤20% (25% for normal renal function) difference between 2 measurements of serum creatinine obtained on 2 occasions separated by at least 2 weeks.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of approximately 18 to 40 kg/m2 inclusive.
- Total body weight >50 kg (110 lbs).
- Male or female subjects between the ages of 18 and 85 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with acute renal disease and/or history of renal transplant.
- Supine BP at Screening ≥160 mm Hg systolic or ≥95 mm Hg diastolic.
- Supine BP at Screening ≤80 mm Hg systolic or ≤40 mm Hg diastolic.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Two centers took part in this study between 15 July 2008 and 21 November 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were enrolled into treatment groups (healthy subjects, mild, moderate, severe renal impairment, or end stage renal impairment on hemodialysis) based on creatinine clearance results obtained closest to the dosing date at screening as determined by the Cockcroft-Gault equation (with the exception of subjects undergoing hemodialysis).

group.title: Healthy Subjects
group.description: (I) Maraviroc single 300 mg dose, followed 4 days later by (II) Maraviroc 150 mg twice a day (BID) co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 6 days, and a single dose of both agents on Day 7.

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg once a day (QD) co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 7 days.

group.title: Moderate Renal Impairment
group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg every 48 hours co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 7 days.

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose.

group.title: ESRD: Single Dose
group.description: (I) Maraviroc single dose one hour following completion of morning hemodialysis, followed at least 1 week later by (II) Maraviroc single dose three hours prior to start of hemodialysis.

group.title: Healthy Subjects
group.description: Subjects with Normal Renal Function (Creatinine Clearance > 80mL/min)

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment
group.description: Subjects with Mild Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance >50 and ≤80 mL/min)

group.title: Moderate Renal Impairment
group.description: Subjects with Moderate Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance ≥30 and ≤50 mL/min)

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Subjects with Severe Renal Impairment (Creatinine Clearance <30 mL/min)

group.title: ESRD on Hemodialysis
group.description: Subjects with End Stage Renal Disease Requiring Regular Hemodialysis 3 Times a Week for at Least 6 Weeks Prior to Screening (Creatinine Clearance <30 mL/min)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measured Concentration (AUClast)
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast) measured in nanograms * hour divided by milliliters (ng*hr/mL).
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population: all subjects treated who have at least 1 of the PK parameters of interest.

group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg twice a day (BID) co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 6 days, and a single dose of both agents on Day 7.

group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose.

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment: Single Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measured Concentration (AUClast)
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast) measured in nanograms * hour divided by milliliters (ng*hr/mL).
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population: all subjects treated who have at least 1 of the PK parameters of interest.

analysis.groups_desc: Ratio (%) test (mild) / reference (normal). AUClast was calculated using the log-linear trapezoidal method.
Ratio (%) test (moderate) / reference (normal). AUClast was calculated using the log-linear trapezoidal method.
Ratio (%) test (severe) / reference (normal). AUClast was calculated using the log-linear trapezoidal method.

outcome.title: AUCtau
outcome.description: AUCtau: area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero to the end of the dosing interval (tau); measured in nanograms * hours divided by milliliters (ng.hr/mL).
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population: all subjects treated who have at least 1 of the PK parameters of interest. AUCtau for end stage renal disease subjects was not determined.

class.title: BL Supine Systolic Blood Pressure (BP) <90 mmHg
Maximum Increase from BL: Supine Systolic BP≥ 30
Maximum Decrease from BL: Supine Systolic BP ≥ 30
BL Supine Diastolic Blood Pressure (BP) <50 mmHg
Maximum Increase from BL: Supine Diastolic BP≥ 20
Maximun Decrease from BL: Supine Diastolic BP ≥20

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Pulse Rate < 40 and > 120 Beats Per Minute
outcome.description: Number of subjects with pulse rate < 40 beats per minute (BPM), number of subjects with pulse rate > 120 BPM.
outcome.time_frame: Normal renal function: screening, Day -3 to Day -1; normal, mild and moderate RI: Day 7 to Day 10 and follow-up; severe RI: Day 1 to Day 4 and follow-up; ESRD: Day 1, Day 4, and follow-up
outcome.population: Safety analysis set: all subjects who received study medication.

group.title: Healthy Subjects: Multiple Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg twice a day (BID) co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 6 days, and a single dose of both agents on Day 7.

group.title: Mild Renal Impairment: Multiple Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg once a day (QD) co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 7 days.

group.title: Moderate Renal Impairment: Multiple Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg every 48 hours co-administered with saquinavir 1,000 mg/ritonavir 100 mg twice a day (BID) for 7 days.

group.title: Healthy Subjects: Single Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose.

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment: Single Dose
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose.

group.title: ESRD: Single Dose; After Dialysis
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose one hour following completion of morning hemodialysis.

group.title: ESRD: Single Dose; Before Dialysis
group.description: Maraviroc 300 mg single dose three hours prior to start of hemodialysis.

measure.title: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Pulse Rate < 40 and > 120 Beats Per Minute
measure.description: Number of subjects with pulse rate < 40 beats per minute (BPM), number of subjects with pulse rate > 120 BPM.
measure.population: Safety analysis set: all subjects who received study medication.

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability of Maraviroc in the Absence and Presence of a Potent CYP3A4 Inhibitor in Subjects With Various Degrees of Renal Impairment or Undergoing Hemodialysis: Number of Subjects With Maximum EGC QTC, QTCB and QTCF Intervals
outcome.description: Single 12-lead ECG: number of subjects with maximum QTC interval, maximum QTCB interval (Bazett's correction), and maximum QTCF interval (Friderica's correction) measured in milliseconds (msec); range: 450 to <480 msec, 480 to <500 msec, and >500 msec. Maximum QTC interval increase from Baseline; citeria: change = ≥ 30 msec to < 60 msec, and change = ≥ 60 msec.
outcome.time_frame: Normal renal function: screening, Day -3 and Day -1; normal renal function, mild and moderate RI: Day 7 to Day 9 and follow-up; severe RI: screening, Day 1, Day 3, Day 4, and follow-up; ESRD: screening, Day 1, Day 3, Day 4, and follow-up
outcome.population: Safety analysis set: all subjects who received study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
